Detailed Description

Const finder for data tags.

Author:
Marc Parizeau, Laboratoire de vision et systèmes numériques, Université Laval

This class is for finding markup tags in a document sub-tree using const iterators (see class Finder for more details).

Definition at line 92 of file Finder.hpp.

Member Function Documentation

XML::ConstIterator XML::ConstFinder::find ( const string &  inPath  ) 

Return the first markup instance that matches path inPath.

Only regular markup is considered in this search. Here is an usage example for finding the first instance of tag "MyTag" in document lDocument: 

Document lDocument;
...
ConstFinder lFinder(lDocument.getFirstDataTag());
// find the first instance
ConstIterator lTag = lFinder.find("//Mytag");
if(lTag)
{
    // process this instance of markup "Mytag"
    ...
}

After processing a found tag, the search may be continued using method Finder::findNext.

00186 {
00187     // reset the path steps 
00188     mSteps.clear();
00189     // parse the search path
00190     istringstream lStream(inPath);
00191     Tokenizer lTokenizer(lStream);
00192     lTokenizer.setDelimiters("", "/");
00193     string lToken;
00194     while(lTokenizer.getNextToken(lToken)) {
00195         // next token should be '/' 
00196         if(lToken[0] != '/') {
00197             // unless path is relative; then make it absolute!
00198             if(mSteps.empty()) {
00199                 mSteps.push_back("*");
00200                 mSteps.push_back(lToken);
00201                 continue;
00202             } else throw runtime_error(string("ConstFinder::find() invalid search path: ")+inPath);
00203         }
00204         int lNextChar = lTokenizer.peekNextChar();
00205         if(lNextChar == -1) break;
00206         // process '//' special case
00207         if(lNextChar == '/') {
00208             // but ignore '///'
00209             if(mSteps.empty() || mSteps.back() != "") mSteps.push_back("");
00210         } else if(lTokenizer.getNextToken(lToken)) mSteps.push_back(lToken);
00211         else break;
00212     }
00213     // search for the path
00214     search(mNode, 0);
00215     // pop first match from queue
00216     ConstIterator lPos;
00217     if(!mMatches.empty()) {
00218         lPos = mMatches.front();
00219         mMatches.pop();
00220     }
00221     // return first match or null iterator
00222     return lPos;
00223 }

XML::ConstIterator XML::ConstFinder::findNext ( void   ) 

Return the next search result.

The search proceeds from the point where the last markup was found. Here is an example where we search for all instances of markup "Mytag" in document lDocument: 

Document lDocument;
...
ConstFinder lFinder(lDocument.getFirstDataTag());
// find all instances of tag
for(ConstIterator lTag = lDocument.find("//Mytag"); lTag; lTag = lDocument.findNext())
{
    // process each instance
    ...
}

void XML::ConstFinder::search ( XML::ConstIterator  inPos,
unsigned int  inStep 
) [protected]

Internal search function.

Search for step inStep starting at position inPos.

00253     // stop recursion?
00254     if(!inPos || inStep >= mSteps.size()) return;
00255     // process current step
00256     if(mSteps[inStep] == "..") {
00257         // move up to parent
00258         if(inPos != mNode) {
00259             if(inStep+1 < mSteps.size()) {
00260                 if(mSteps[inStep+1] == "..") search(inPos->getParent(), inStep+1);
00261                 else {
00262                     for(ConstIterator lPos = inPos->getParent()->getFirstChild(); lPos; ++lPos)
00263                         search(lPos, inStep+1);
00264                 }
00265             } else mMatches.push(inPos->getParent());
00266         } 
00267     } else if(mSteps[inStep] == "") {
00268         // walk tree in level order
00269         queue<ConstIterator> lSearchQueue;
00270         lSearchQueue.push(inPos);
00271         while(!lSearchQueue.empty()) {
00272             // get next node
00273             ConstIterator lPos = lSearchQueue.front();
00274             lSearchQueue.pop();
00275             // push all its children onto the search queue
00276             for(ConstIterator lChild = lPos->getFirstChild(); lChild; ++lChild) lSearchQueue.push(lChild);
00277             // if not last step, search recursively
00278             if(inStep+1 < mSteps.size()) search(lPos, inStep+1);
00279             else mMatches.push(lPos);
00280         }
00281     } else {
00282         if(mSteps[inStep] == "*" || inPos->getValue() == mSteps[inStep]) {
00283             // found a match
00284             if(inStep+1 < mSteps.size()) {
00285                 if(mSteps[inStep+1] == "..") search(inPos, inStep+1);
00286                 else {
00287                     for(ConstIterator lPos = inPos->getFirstChild(); lPos; ++lPos)
00288                         search(lPos, inStep+1);
00289                 }
00290             } else mMatches.push(inPos);
00291         }
